fr.univrennes1.cri.jtacl.lib.ip
Class IPNet

java.lang.Object
  fr.univrennes1.cri.jtacl.lib.ip.IPNet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable
public class IPNet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable

Class and tools to deal with IPv4 and IPv6 addresses and networks.
An IP address is a BigInteger number between 0 and 2^128, and could have a prefix length to specify network mask.

Mostly taken from IPy http://pypi.python.org/pypi/IPy

Author:
Patrick Lamaiziere

IPNet

public IPNet(java.lang.String data)
      throws java.net.UnknownHostException
Constructs a new IPNet object according to the string data.

Several notations are supported:
  • Decimal: IPNet("n")
    n <= 255 -> assumed to be the IPv4 address n.0.0.0
    example 127 -> 127.0.0.0
  • n >= 256 -> assumed to be the address 'n'.
    If n is less than 2^32 theIPversion is set to IPv4, else to IPv6.
  • Hexadecimal: IPNet("0xn")
    the number n is converted to the address ip as a number
  • Dot notation (IPv4) : 'IPNet("x.y.w.z")
    if less than 4 bytes are specified, it is padded with some "0"
    ex: 127.0 -> 127.0.0.0
  • Ipv6: IPv6 notation is supported, as well as an IPv4 address specified
    at the tail of the string
    ex: IPNet("::1:127.0.0.1")
  • Netmask and prefix
    IPv4: /n or /w.x.y.z
    IPv6: /n only
  • Range
    a range between two addresses can be specified, the first IP address is used as the address of the IPNet ip and the second is used to compute the prefixlen. This is only supported for IPv4.
    ex: IPNet("0.0.0.0-255.255.255.255)

Parameters:
data - The String string to parse.
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException - if some parameters are invalid or if we can't parse the string.

networkContains

public boolean networkContains(IPNet ipnet)
                        throws java.net.UnknownHostException
Checks if this IPNet instance contains another IPNet object.
An IPNet object contains another IPNet object if all the IP addresses designated by the second IPNet object are included in the first IPNet object.

Parameters:
ipnet - IPNet object to compare.
Returns:
true if all the IP addresses of the IPNet ipnet object are included in this instance.
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException

overlaps

public boolean overlaps(IPNet ipnet)
                 throws java.net.UnknownHostException
Checks if this IPNet instance overlaps the IPNet object in argument. Two IPNet objects overlap if they share at least one IP address.

Parameters:
ipnet - IPNet object to compare.
Returns:
true if this IPNet instance overlaps the IPNet object in argument.
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException

isBetweenIP

public boolean isBetweenIP(IPNet first,
                           IPNet second)
Checks if this IPNet instance is between two another IPNet objects.

Parameters:
first - the first IPNet object to compare.
second - the second IPNet object to compare.
Returns:
true if the BigInteger IP address of this instance is: first <= IP <= second. We do not take care of the prefix length of the IPNet objects.

hostAddress

public IPNet hostAddress()
                  throws java.net.UnknownHostException
Returns the host IP address of this IPNet instance. The host address is expressed by setting the prefixlen to 32 or 128 according to the IP version of the instance.

Returns:
the IPNet host address.
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException

isNullNetwork

public boolean isNullNetwork()
Checks if this IPNet instance designates the "null" network.
The "null" network is 0.0.0.0/0 for IPv4 and ::0/0 for IPv6

Returns:
true if this IPNet instance designates the "null" network.

networkLength

public java.math.BigInteger networkLength()
Returns the length of this IPNet instance. The length is the number of IP addresses associates to the network designated by the IPNet instance.

examples:
IPNet("192.0.0.1/24") => 256 addresses.
IPNet("192.0.0.1/32") => 1 address.

Returns:
the BigInteger number of IP addresses associates to the network designated by the IPNet instance.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

toString

public java.lang.String toString(java.lang.String format)
Returns a String representation of this IPNet instance according to the String format.

Formats:
  • 'i': (ip) do not output the prefix length.
  • 'n': (netmask use a netmask representation to output the prefix length (IPv4 only).
  • 's': (short) never output the prefix length.
  • '::' (compress) compress the output for IPv6 address.

Parameters:
format - Format string
Returns:
a String representation of this IPNet instance.
